intro: Senecio microphyllus, commonly known as the dwarf senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it requires careful management to prevent it from becoming invasive.
